item.title: 凯茜-伍德认为特朗普议程将重振美国 IPO
item.description: 凯茜-伍德（Cathie Wood）打赌唐纳德-特朗普的监管和增长议程将重振美国首次公开募股市场。【原文：Cathie Wood is betting Donald Trump’s regulatory and growth agenda will revive the market for US initial public offerings.】

item.title: 三星将凭借 Galaxy S25 Edge 超薄手机击败苹果
item.description: 三星电子公司计划在今年上半年推出超薄版 Galaxy S25 手机，从而击败苹果公司，成为一个前景广阔的新品类。【原文：Samsung Electronics Co. plans to launch an ultrathin version of its Galaxy S25 phone in the first half of this year, beating Apple Inc. to a promising new category.】

item.title: 如果弗里兰当选，她将取消加拿大的资本利得加息政策
item.description: 据一位知情人士透露，如果克里斯蒂娅-弗里兰（Chrystia Freeland）在接替贾斯汀-特鲁多（Justin Trudeau）担任总理的竞选中获胜，她将放弃加拿大政府提高资本收益纳入税率的政策。【原文：Chrystia Freeland would drop the Canadian government’s policy of raising the capital gains inclusion rate if she wins the race to replace Justin Trudeau as prime minister, according to a person with knowledge of her plan.】

item.title: 没人对你的加密哲学感兴趣
item.description: 大家好，欢迎收看《奇货可居》时事通讯，这里每天都有来自《奇货可居》的精彩内容。有时是我们乔-韦森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）为您带来我们对市场、金融和经济最新发展的看法。有时是我们的专家嘉宾和消息来源网络提供的内容。不管是什么，我们保证永远有趣。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.】

item.title: 荷兰总理表示，特朗普将大力推动 ASML 出口管制
item.description: 荷兰首相迪克-肖夫（Dick Schoof）表示，荷兰预计唐纳德-特朗普总统将继续施加压力，限制 ASML Holding NV 向中国出口芯片制造设备。【原文：The Netherlands expects President Donald Trump to keep pressing to restrict ASML Holding NV’s exports of chip-making machines to China, according to Dutch Prime Minister Dick Schoof.】

item.title: 欧盟建议将伦敦清算所豁免延长至 2028 年
item.description: 欧盟提议允许伦敦继续为集团内的贸易清算至 2028 年，这与欧盟此前关于脱欧后安排将于今年夏天结束的誓言背道而驰。【原文：The European Union proposed allowing London to continue clearing the bloc’s trades until 2028, a departure from its previous vow that the post-Brexit arrangement would end this summer.】

item.title: 航运亿万富翁弗雷德里克森在长达十年的石油交易诉讼中败诉
item.description: 英国法官驳回了约翰-弗雷德里克森（John Fredriksen）对阿卡迪亚集团（Arcadia Group）前高管的重大欺诈指控，使他在近十年的诉讼中败诉。【原文：Shipping billionaire John Fredriksen lost a near decade-long court case against former top executives of Arcadia Group after a UK judge dismissed claims of major fraud.】

item.title: 加州大学在招生人数创历史新高的情况下动用公共基金 20 亿美元
item.description: 加州大学系统本周将加入高等教育的借贷热潮，计划出售 20 亿美元的免税收入债务。【原文：The University of California system is joining the borrowing boom in higher education this week with plans to sell $2 billion of tax-exempt revenue debt.】

item.title: 布兰森支持的热气球旅游公司因资金短缺裁员
item.description: Space Perspective 是理查德-布兰森（Richard Branson）支持的一家初创公司，该公司希望用气球把游客带到平流层。【原文：Space Perspective, a Richard Branson-backed startup that wants to take tourists to the stratosphere in a balloon, furloughed almost all of its workforce late last year after running low on cash.】

item.title: 三星寄希望于人工智能的发展来刺激新款 S25 手机的需求
item.description: 三星电子公司（Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd.）正依靠人工智能的全面革新和经过调整的硬件设计来销售其新系列的 Galaxy S25 智能手机。【原文：Samsung Electronics Co. is banking on an artificial intelligence overhaul and tweaked hardware designs to sell its new line of Galaxy S25 smartphones.】

item.title: 三星将进军 AR 眼镜市场，与 Meta 和苹果展开竞争
item.description: 三星电子公司（Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd.）的移动业务高管表示，该公司有望与 Alphabet 公司旗下的谷歌公司（Google）合作进军增强现实眼镜市场，一跃成为突然升温的产品类别。【原文：Samsung Electronics Co. expects to enter the augmented reality glasses market in partnership with Alphabet Inc.’s Google, according to the company’s top mobile executive, jumping into a product category that is suddenly heating up.】

item.title: SAP 首席财务官称公司反对欧洲 "极右翼 "势力崛起
item.description: 德国软件公司 SAP SE 首席财务官多米尼克-阿萨姆（Dominik Asam）表示，该公司对 "极右翼 "在欧洲日益增长的影响力感到担忧，并不希望其掌权。【原文：German software company SAP SE is concerned with the growing influence of the “very far right” in Europe and doesn’t want it in power, according to its Chief Financial Officer Dominik Asam.】

item.title: 贝恩酝酿以 15 亿欧元出售化学品公司 Italmatch
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，贝恩资本正在考虑出售意大利意马化工公司（Italmatch Chemicals SpA）的可能性，该公司的交易价值可能达到 15 亿欧元（16 亿美元）。【原文：Bain Capital is considering a possible sale of Italmatch Chemicals SpA, which could be valued at €1.5 billion ($1.6 billion) in a deal, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 加拿大各省的借贷利差将因关税问题而上升
item.description: 由于美国对来自加拿大的商品加征关税可能会抑制经济增长，加拿大各省的相对借贷成本将上升。【原文：Canadian provinces are set to see their relative borrowing costs rise as US tariffs on goods from the country threaten to throttle economic growth.】

item.title: 价值 540 亿美元的公司如何应对勒索软件攻击
item.description: 达沃斯世界经济论坛的一个小组讨论了一家市值 540 亿美元的公司被黑客攻击后的后果。但首先...【原文：A panel at the World Economic Forum in Davos discusses the aftermath of a hack of a $54 billion company. But first…】

item.title: 泽连斯基在达沃斯向特朗普发出呼吁
item.description: 您好，来自达沃斯，众多领导人和高管正在这里参加世界经济论坛年会。【原文：Hello from Davos, where a panoply of leaders and executives have been attending the World Economic Forum’s annual meetings.】

item.title: 贝莱德的芬克称通胀加剧是全球 "最大的风险
item.description: 贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc.首席执行官拉里-芬克（Larry Fink）说，投资者过早地得出了高通胀已经结束的结论，这就增加了债券收益率将随着物价上涨而上升的可能性。【原文：BlackRock Inc. Chief Executive Officer Larry Fink said investors are too quick to conclude that high inflation is over, raising the prospect that bond yields will rise along with steeper prices.】

item.title: 摩根大通为甲骨文数据中心提供 23 亿美元贷款
item.description: 摩根大通公司正在为德克萨斯州阿比林市的一个数据中心开发项目贷款 23 亿美元，该项目由蓝猫头鹰资本公司（Blue Owl Capital Inc.【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co. is lending $2.3 billion for a data center development in Abilene, Texas, that’s owned by Blue Owl Capital Inc. and its partners.】

item.title: Epic Games基于《堡垒之夜》的Roblox杀手仍需努力
item.description: 史诗游戏公司（Epic Games Inc. 是大获成功的《堡垒之夜》（Fortnite）视频游戏的发行商）两年前发起了一项倡议，要在快速增长的用户生成游戏业务中与行业领导者 Roblox 公司一较高下。【原文：Epic Games Inc., publisher of the wildly successful Fortnite video game, launched an initiative two years ago to take on industry leader Roblox Corp. in the fast-growing business of user-generated games.】

item.title: 谷歌在英国赢得裁决，阻止了价值超过全球 GDP 的俄罗斯罚款
item.description: Alphabet Inc. 旗下的谷歌公司赢得了英国法院的裁决，阻止俄罗斯媒体公司扣押这家科技巨头的全球资产，以追回俄罗斯法院判处的罚款。【原文：Alphabet Inc.’s Google won a UK court ruling to block Russian media firms from seizing the tech giant’s global assets to recover Russian court-imposed fines that have now accrued interest equal to many times more than the world’s economy combined.】

item.title: KKR 合并价值 1570 亿美元的基础设施和房地产业务
item.description: KKR & Co.正将其基础设施和房地产资产交由同一领导层管理，以利用快速扩张的投资部门之间的融合机会。【原文：KKR & Co. is moving its infrastructure and real estate assets under the same leadership as it looks to capitalize on converging opportunities between the rapidly expanding investing units.】

item.title: 人类学公司首席执行官称 OpenAI 的 "星际之门 "风险投资看似 "混乱
item.description: Anthropic 首席执行官达里奥-阿莫代（Dario Amodei）对竞争对手 OpenAI 5000 亿美元基础设施项目的融资表示怀疑，并称计划中的项目 "有点混乱"。【原文：Anthropic Chief Executive Officer Dario Amodei expressed skepticism about the financing for rival OpenAI’s $500 billion infrastructure venture and called the planned project “a bit chaotic.”】

item.title: Salesforce 预计其 Agentforce AI 产品本季度将完成数千笔交易
item.description: Salesforce Inc.首席执行官马克-贝尼奥夫（Marc Benioff）表示，本财季将有 "成千上万 "的交易使用其新的 Agentforce AI 产品。【原文：Salesforce Inc. Chief Executive Officer Marc Benioff said there will be “thousands” of deals for its new Agentforce AI product in the current fiscal quarter.】

item.title: 思科首席执行官称政治紧张局势推动数据主权化进程
item.description: 思科系统公司（Cisco Systems Inc.首席执行官查克-罗宾斯（Chuck Robbins）说，他认为地缘政治紧张局势推动了数据主权的发展，使他的业务变得更加复杂。【原文：Cisco Systems Inc. Chief Executive Officer Chuck Robbins said he sees geopolitical tensions driving a push for data sovereignty that’s making his business more complex.】

item.title: 沙特阿拉伯因欧佩克+供应举措遭国际货币基金组织（IMF）下调经济增长评级
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）以石油联盟欧佩克+（OPEC+）决定延长减产为由，下调了沙特阿拉伯的经济增长预期，下调幅度超过其追踪的其他主要经济体。【原文：The International Monetary Fund downgraded its growth forecasts for Saudi Arabia by more than any other major economy it tracks, citing the decision by the oil alliance OPEC+ to extend production cuts.】

item.title: 被制裁的国际货币基金组织（IMF）总裁将移居华盛顿
item.description: 俄罗斯驻国际货币基金组织执行董事会的代表已获得华盛顿的许可，可以移居美国，这是对2022年入侵乌克兰所实施制裁的缓刑。【原文：Russia’s representative to the International Monetary Fund’s executive board has received permission by Washington to move to the US, a reprieve from sanctions imposed in response to the 2022 invasion of Ukraine.】

item.title: 贸易战威胁加拿大银行股在暴涨 27% 之后的反弹
item.description: 加拿大国家银行（National Bank of Canada）的分析师表示，加拿大银行股的反弹面临潜在贸易战的风险，贸易战将迅速导致失业率和贷款违约激增。【原文：The rally in Canadian bank equities is at risk from a potential trade war that would quickly cause a surge in unemployment and loan defaults, analysts at National Bank of Canada said.】

item.title: 收益不佳，Baupost 客户自 2021 年以来撤资 70 亿美元
item.description: 塞斯-克拉曼（Seth Klarman）的 Baupost 集团的客户在过去三年中从该对冲基金撤资约 70 亿美元，在经历了十年的低迷回报后，他们对这位著名的价值投资者失去了耐心。【原文：Clients of Seth Klarman’s Baupost Group pulled roughly $7 billion from the hedge fund in the past three years, losing patience with the famed value investor after a decade of lackluster returns.】

item.title: 亚马逊将关闭在魁北克省的所有仓库，裁员 1,900 人
item.description: 亚马逊公司将关闭加拿大法语区魁北克省的所有仓库并裁员。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. will shut down all warehouses and lay off employees in the French-speaking Canadian province of Quebec.】

item.title: 英国皇家财务报告委员会称，英国 5 亿英镑农业税的收入将低于预期
item.description: 英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）在预算责任办公室（Office for Budget Responsibility）的一份分析报告中指出，从长远来看，由于家庭利用税收规划来规避遗产税，英国农场遗产税的征收可能会低于预期。【原文：Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves’ extension of inheritance tax to UK farms may raise less than hoped in the longer term as families use tax planning to avoid the levy, according to an analysis by the Office for Budget Responsibility.】
